column3: X is related to Y in a way that cannot be specified by another code value
X includes Y (where the product described in the ONIX record is X and the related product is Y)
X is part of Y – use for 'also available as part of'
X replaces, or is new edition of, Y
X is replaced by, or has new edition, Y
X is available in an alternative format as Y – indicates an alternative format of the same content which is or may be available.
X has an ancillary or supplementary product Y
X is ancillary or supplementary to Y
X is remaindered as Y, when a remainder merchant assigns its own identifier to the product
X was originally sold as Y, indicating the publisher's original identifier for a title which is offered as a remainder under a different identifier
X is an other-language version of Y
X has a publisher's suggested alternative Y, which does not, however, carry the same content (cf 05 and 06)
X is an epublication based on printed product Y
X is an epublication 'rendered' as Y – use when the ONIX record describes a package of electronic content which is available in multiple 'renderings'
X is a 'rendering' of an epublication Y – use when the ONIX record describes a specific rendering of an epublication content package, to identify the package
X is a POD replacement for Y – Y is an out-of-print product replaced by a print-on-demand version under a new ISBN
X is replaced by POD Y – Y is a print-on-demand replacement, under a new ISBN, for an out-of-print product X

X is a special edition of Y - used for a special edition (German: Sonderausgabe) with different cover, binding etc - more than ‘alternative format’ - which may be available in limited quantity and for a limited time
X has a special edition Y - the reciprocal of code 18

X is a prebound edition of Y (in the US, a prebound edition is ‘a book that was previously bound and has been rebound with a library quality hardcover binding. In almost all commercial cases, the book in question began as a paperback.’)
X is the regular edition of which Y is a prebound edition
X and Y have a common author
Y is another product that is suggested as similar to X (‘if you liked X, you may also like Y’)
X is a facsimile edition of Y
X is the original edition from which a facsimile edition Y is taken
X is a license for digital product Y, traded or supplied separately
Y is an electronic version of print product X (reciprocal of code 13)
